p: Kamatou and collaborators [ 36] investigated other South African species and noted a poor antimicrobial activity of the three sage EOs. Later, van Vuuren [ 30] demonstrated the highest activity of S. africana-caerulea EO against the Brevibacillus agri foot-odor causing bacterium. This oil was characterized by viridiflorol (36.7%) and limonene (25.7%).
